findings.title: Owner privileges
findings.description: The owner has excessive privileges to control the contract, including enabling/disabling fees, pausing the contract, blacklisting addresses, and changing various fee values.

findings.title: Owner can enable / disable the fee.
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to enable or disable fees, which could lead to potential security risks if misused.

findings.title: Owner can pause the contract.
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to pause the contract, which could lead to potential disruptions or unauthorized control over the contract's functionality.

findings.title: Unrestricted Blacklisting Capability
findings.description: The owner has the ability to blacklist any address, revoking its permission to transfer funds.

findings.title: Owner can change the auto burn fee value
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the auto burn fee value, which could lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Owner can change the manual burn fee value.
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the manual burn fee value without any restrictions.

findings.title: Owner can change the liquidity fee value.
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the liquidity fee value, which could lead to unintended consequences or malicious activities.

findings.title: Owner can change the dev fee value.
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the developer fee value.

findings.title: Owner can change the minimum token amount for liquidity.
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify the minimum token amount required for liquidity, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can change the maximum tx amount
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the maximum transaction amount, which could lead to potential security risks.
